New Records: Adolis García's 15 RBIs are the most ever in a postseason series.
Key Match Events: Adolis García went 4-for-5 with two homers, a stolen base, and five RBIs in Game 7.
García hit a grand slam in Game 6 after striking out four times.
García hit a three-run homer in Game 5 to give the Rangers a 4-2 lead.
Bryan Abreu was suspended two games for intentionally throwing at García in Game 5.
Post-Match Reflections: Corey Seager praised García's performance, calling him a 'bad man'.
Astros manager Dusty Baker acknowledged García's impact, stating he is 'getting badder'.
Rangers outfielder Robbie Grossman described García's grand slam in Game 6 as a 'cool moment'.
Rangers second baseman Marcus Semien praised García as a great teammate and leader.
Rangers GM Chris Young highlighted García's strong character and work ethic.
Miscellaneous Highlights: García's journey included playing in the Cuban National Series, defecting to Japan, and eventually joining the Rangers.
García was designated for assignment by both the Cardinals and Rangers before making it to the majors.
García made his first All-Star team while playing for a Rangers club that lost 102 games.
García's grand slam in Game 6 was a 110-mph shot into the Crawford Boxes in left field.
